title: V-HOP: Visuo-Haptic 6D Object Pose Tracking
author: Hongyu Li (Brown University), Mingxi Jia (Brown University), Tuluhan Akbulut (Brown University), Yu Xiang (UT Dallas), George Konidaris (Brown University), Srinath Sridhar (Brown University)
relevance_why: This paper explores sensor integration techniques that may offer insights for audio-visual scenarios in speech and sound processing, particularly in applications that require robust object interactions.
background: 6D object pose tracking: estimating the 3D position and orientation of an object in space using both visual and haptic feedback.
contribution: This work introduces a visuo-haptic tracking approach that achieves improved object pose estimation in real-world conditions, overcoming limitations of existing visual-only techniques.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Previous methods suffer from generalization issues and typically process visual and haptic inputs independently, leading to less coherent tracking over time.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates visual and haptic data through a transformer model and a unified haptic representation, enhancing robustness and adaptability across different environments.

key_innovation: Develops a novel unified haptic point cloud representation that incorporates both tactile and kinesthetic data to support cross-embodiment learning.
real_world_impact: The proposed method significantly enhances the performance of robotic manipulation tasks under challenging conditions, demonstrating potential for practical applications in automation and robotics.
limitations: The method assumes a CAD model is available for the object, which poses limitations for applications where object shapes are not predefined.

new_terms.visuo-haptic: **Visuo-haptic** refers to the integration of visual (sight) and haptic (touch) inputs to improve the perception and interaction with objects.
new_terms.6D object pose: **6D object pose** encompasses both the 3D spatial position and rotation of an object, crucial for accurate tracking in robotic manipulations.

open_sourcing: The model and dataset will be made open source upon acceptance of the paper.
